definition: general rule/general principle
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items

sentences.english: NPC deputies will review the draft general provisions of civil law of China.
sentences.chinese: 全国人大代表将审议《民法通则草案》总则。

sentences.english: They may be used to interpret or supplement domestic law.
sentences.chinese: 通则可用以解释或补充国内法。

sentences.english: "General Principles of Civil Law" is the basis of establishment of civil code.
sentences.chinese: 《民法通则》是民法总则编制定的基础与胚胎。

sentences.english: The stipulation of lost property in the Civil Law of our country is too simple and general.
sentences.chinese: 我国民法通则对拾得制度的规定过于简略。

sentences.english: The staff of IMCO shall be employed and managed by the personnel department of IMCO according to general rules.
sentences.chinese: 其他工作人员由人事部门依照层级管理的通则任用。

sentences.english: These Principles set forth general rules for international commercial contracts.
sentences.chinese: 通则旨在为国际商事合同制定一般规则。

definition: clause/explanatory section in a document
abbr. for 黃帝內經|黄帝内经[Huang2 di4 Nei4 jing1], The Yellow Emperor's Internal Canon, medical text c. 300 BC
energy channels/meridian (TCM)/(dialect) trick/tactic
normal and proper practice/conventional practice/common occurrence
classic book/sutra
profile/general provision (law)
"eight principles," a method of giving a general description and syndrome differentiation (TCM)
twelve channels of TCM
the gist (of a text or argument)/the main points
pattern-syndrome identification based on the eight principles (TCM)

Six Classics, namely: Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], Book of History 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], Book of Rites 儀禮|仪礼[Yi2 li3], the lost Book of Music 樂經|乐经[Yue4 jing1], Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1]
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
twelve channels of TCM
to obstruct
principle/logic

(TCM) six bowels (hollow organs), namely: gall bladder 膽|胆[dan3], stomach 胃[wei4], large intestine 大腸|大肠[da4 chang2], small intestine 小腸|小肠[xiao3 chang2], triple heater 三焦[san1 jiao1], bladder 膀胱[pang2 guang1]
